skill.name: pr-template-generator
skill.description: Generate comprehensive pull request descriptions that help reviewers understand changes quickly a...
skill.summary: Generate comprehensive pull request descriptions that help reviewers understand changes quickly a...
skill.author: CuriousLearner

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no code execution, file access, or network capabilities. Provides instructions for generating PR descriptions.

content.value_statement: Create comprehensive pull request descriptions that help reviewers understand changes quickly. Save time and improve code review quality with structured templates.
actual_capabilities: Generate feature PR descriptions with structured templates
Create bug fix documentation with root cause analysis
Build refactoring PRs with before/after comparisons
Include breaking changes and migration guides
Suggest related issues and reviewer assignments
limitations: Does not access git repositories directly
Does not execute git commands or analyze code
User must provide change context manually
Does not integrate with GitHub or GitLab APIs

use_cases.title: Document feature additions
use_cases.description: Create detailed PR descriptions for new features with motivation, implementation details, and testing strategy.

use_cases.title: Track bug fix details
use_cases.description: Document bug fixes with root cause analysis, impact assessment, and deployment considerations.

use_cases.title: Review code refactors
use_cases.description: Generate comprehensive refactor documentation with architecture changes and migration guides.

prompt_templates.title: Simple PR
prompt_templates.prompt: @pr-template-generator Generate a pull request description for a feature that adds user authentication with OAuth support.

prompt_templates.title: Bug Fix
prompt_templates.prompt: @pr-template-generator --type bugfix Create a PR description for fixing a memory leak in the websocket handler. Include root cause, fix details, and testing performed.

prompt_templates.title: Refactor
prompt_templates.prompt: @pr-template-generator --type refactor Generate documentation for refactoring the payment processing module to improve maintainability and testability.

prompt_templates.title: Complete PR
prompt_templates.prompt: @pr-template-generator --include-screenshots Create a comprehensive PR description for a UI overhaul including screenshots, breaking changes, migration steps, and deployment checklist.

output_examples.input: Generate a PR description for a feature that adds email notifications
output: Title: feat: Add email notification system for order updates
Summary: Implements email notifications for order status changes
Motivation: Users need email alerts when order status changes
Changes: Added notification service, email templates, scheduled jobs
Testing: Unit tests added, manual testing completed in staging
Checklist: Code follows style guidelines, docs updated, no breaking changes

best_practices: Include the problem statement and solution approach in every description
Add screenshots or diagrams for visual changes
Link related issues and explain breaking changes clearly
Provide specific focus areas for reviewers to examine
anti_patterns: Using vague titles like 'Update code' or 'Fix stuff'
Skipping testing information and checklist items
Assuming reviewers have full context of the changes
Forgetting to mention deployment or migration requirements

faq.question: Which platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Use the @pr-template-generator command to invoke it.

faq.question: What types of PRs can this generate?
faq.answer: It generates templates for features, bug fixes, refactoring, documentation updates, and performance improvements.

faq.question: Does it connect to GitHub or GitLab?
faq.answer: No, this skill generates descriptions based on your input. It does not access repositories or APIs directly.

faq.question: Is my code or data shared anywhere?
faq.answer: No. This skill runs entirely in your AI session. No data is transmitted to external servers.

faq.question: Can I customize the templates?
faq.answer: Yes, you can extend the prompts with flags like --type, --include-screenshots, or --minimal to customize output.

faq.question: How is this different from GitHub PR templates?
faq.answer: GitHub templates provide static forms. This skill generates dynamic, context-aware descriptions based on your specific changes.
